snippet.title: Learn JavaScript - Full Course for Beginners
snippet.description:
This complete 134-part JavaScript tutorial for beginners will teach you everything you need to know to get started with the JavaScript programming language.

‚úèÔ∏è Course created by @beau 

Click the ‚öôÔ∏è to change to a dub track in Hindi (Dubbed via Melt Labs - https://www.withmelt.com/)

‚≠êÔ∏èCurriculum‚≠êÔ∏è
This is a stand-alone video but it follows the JavaScript curriculum at freecodecamp.org. Access the curriculum here:
üîó Basic JavaScript: https://learn.freecodecamp.org/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/basic-javascript
üîó ES6 JavaScript: https://learn.freecodecamp.org/javascript-algorithms-and-data-structures/es6

‚≠êÔ∏èCode‚≠êÔ∏è
This course was created using scrimba.com. Access the course there along with the code:
üîó Basic JavaScript: https://scrimba.com/playlist/pny4ghw
üîó ES6 JavaScript: https://scrimba.com/playlist/p7v3gCd

‚ù§Ô∏è Try interactive JavaScript courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-JavaScript (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)

snippet.title: JavaScript DOM Manipulation ‚Äì Full Course for Beginners
snippet.description:
Learn about JavaScript DOM manipulation in this beginner's tutorial. This is when you use JavaScript to add, remove, and modify elements of a website. 

In the first part of the course, you will learn about the basic features of a website DOM and the JavaScript commands you can use to manipulate the DOM. In the second part of the course, you will use what you have learned to create practical examples ranging from beginner to advanced. 

‚úèÔ∏è CodeLab created this course. Check out their channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/CodeLab98

‚ù§Ô∏è Try interactive JavaScript courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-JavaScript (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)

snippet.title: JavaScript Game Development Course for Beginners
snippet.description:
Learn to make 2D games with HTML, CSS & plain vanilla JavaScript, no frameworks and no libraries! From sprite animation to state management, in this series of projects you will learn everything you need to make your own 2D animated games! We will go step by step explaining each technique on a small standalone codebase and then we will use everything we learned to make a single final game.

‚úèÔ∏è Course by Frank's Laboratory. https://www.youtube.com/c/Frankslaboratory

‚≠êÔ∏è Assets ‚≠êÔ∏è
üïπ Project 1: Vanilla JavaScript sprite animation techniques
http://frankslaboratory.co.uk/downloads/shadow_dog.png

üïπ Project 2: Parallax backgrounds with JavaScript
Layers Zip: https://frankslaboratory.co.uk/downloads/backgroundLayers.zip

üïπ Project 3: Enemy movement patterns
Enemies Zip: https://frankslaboratory.co.uk/downloads/enemies.zip

üïπ Project 4: Collision animations from a sprite sheet
http://frankslaboratory.co.uk/downloads/boom.png

raven: http://frankslaboratory.co.uk/downloads/raven.png
dust cloud: http://frankslaboratory.co.uk/downloads/boom.png

snippet.title: Self-Driving Car with JavaScript Course ‚Äì Neural Networks and Machine Learning
snippet.description:
Learn how to create a neural network using JavaScript with no libraries. In this course you will learn to make a self-driving car simulation by implementing every component step-by-step. You will learn how to implement the car driving mechanics, how to define the environment, how to simulate some sensors, how to detect collisions, and how to make the car control itself using a neural network.

The course covers how artificial neural networks work, by comparing them with the real neural networks in our brain. You will learn how to implement a neural network and how to visualize it so we can see it in action.

‚úèÔ∏è Dr. Radu Mariescu-Istodor created this course. Check out his channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3XGlNq8O5hZlZBJlSFB4jg

üíª Code: https://github.com/gniziemazity/Self-driving-car

‚ù§Ô∏è Try interactive JavaScript courses we love, right in your browser: https://scrimba.com/freeCodeCamp-JavaScript (Made possible by a grant from our friends at Scrimba)

‚≠êÔ∏è Course Contents ‚≠êÔ∏è
‚å®Ô∏è (0:00:00) Intro
‚å®Ô∏è (0:03:44) Car driving mechanics
‚å®Ô∏è (0:32:26) Defining the road
‚å®Ô∏è (0:50:50) Artificial sensors
‚å®Ô∏è (1:10:07) Collision detection
‚å®Ô∏è (1:23:20) Simulating traffic
‚å®Ô∏è (1:34:57) Neural network
‚å®Ô∏è (2:03:10) Parallelization
‚å®Ô∏è (2:18:31) Genetic algorithm
‚å®Ô∏è (2:29:40) Ending

snippet.title: Full Stack Web Development for Beginners (Full Course on HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Node.js, MongoDB)
snippet.description:
Learn full-stack web development in this full course for beginners. First, you will learn the basics of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Then, you will learn how to put everything together to create a frontend movie search app. Finally, you will learn how to create a backend API to create movie reviews and connect the frontend to the backend. The backend uses Node.js, Express, and MongoDB.

üîó Get started with Replit: https://join.replit.com/web-students

‚úèÔ∏è Tomi Tokko and Beau Carnes developed this course. 
Tomi's channel: https://www.youtube.com/CodeWithTomi
Beau's channel: https://www.youtube.com/beau

Backend Reviews API: https://replit.com/@BeauCarnes/review-backend
Frontend connected to backend: https://replit.com/@BeauCarnes/htmlfrontend
